content: hiya, i'm planning on putting up a draft PR sometime over the weekend to warn/deny "almost" trivial bounds with HRTBs like fn foo() where for<'a> &'a mut (): Clone {} and i want to start a crater run..
is there any courtesy around starting a crater run, or am i allowed to start one if i think it's significant enough?
it just occurred to me to ask, since it's significantly more resources than just doing a perf run, lol
Well... resources are allocated and paid for anyway, so if the queue runs empty, that would be a waste :wink:
alright, unless there's a ton queued up, i'll just go for it
Anyway, this sounds exactly like something that we run crater for. In the future, when you know which crates are interesting for your case, you can even limit the run to those

Especially since it sounds like this could be a check run (no test failure relevance), which is somewhat cheaper, queuing it sounds fine.

One good thing you might do is mention the priority of your run in the comment that kicks it off -- I've had people ask if it's ok to cancel (or deprioritize) one I've kicked, so if yours is "I'd like this but it's not critical for the release next week" that can be a good thing to note in your thread.
